meanings.definition: a person or thing that causes something to break up or fall apart
meanings.sent1: The earthquake acted as a disintegrators, shaking the building until it collapsed.
meanings.sent2: Over time, neglect can be a disintegrators of relationships, causing them to deteriorate.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel turned out to be the disintegrators of the peaceful picnic.
meanings.sent4: The rumor spread like a disintegrators, tearing apart friendships in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The villain in the movie was portrayed as a disintegrators, destroying everything in his path.

meanings.definition: a machine or device that breaks down materials into smaller pieces
meanings.sent1: The industrial disintegrators in the factory efficiently crushed the rocks into tiny particles.
meanings.sent2: The blender in the kitchen can be considered a disintegrators, turning fruits into smoothies.
meanings.sent3: The disintegrators in the recycling plant hummed as it shredded the paper into bits.
meanings.sent4: The wood chipper roared like a disintegrators, reducing branches to wood chips.
meanings.sent5: The demolition team used a powerful disintegrators to pulverize the concrete walls.
